page.title: 13BRITISH TIMKEN
page.content: The first part of British Timken was built in 1944 but over the years it has expanded.British Timken is an American company and Duston is the H.Q.of Timken Europe. The weighbridge weighs lorries that come in and out.It has been there for 17 years and is now too small.They are building a new one soon.An average of 15 lorries are weighed every day.The scales go up to 40 tonnes. Inside the cubicle at the weighbridge there are 3 kinds of form.When a lorry carries tubes a small form is filled in and put in a box as proof of delivery. The others are for lorries which carry cage strip and for those carrying scrap.Most of the scrap goes to Birmingham.
